intro: Krascheninikovia stellarioides, commonly known as the Antarctic hair grass, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the cold climates of Antarctica and sub-Antarctic regions. It has a rosette structure with narrow, grass-like leaves that are covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in its harsh environment. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters at the ends of its stems. It is adapted to survive in nutrient-poor soils and extreme cold, with a slow growth rate and a long lifespan. Krascheninikovia stellarioides plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for local microorganisms in its extreme habitat.
